channel.title: Traversing a Trie :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Traversing a Trie As with other kinds of trees, there are occasions where we need to process all the elements stored in a trie in order. Here, the elements are strings, which are not stored explicitly in the trie, but implicitly based on the labels of various nodes. Thus, an individual node does not contain a string; however, if its bool has a value of true, then the path to that node describes a string stored in the trie.
